Package entities

Class Collective

java.lang.Object
entities.Collective
All Implemented Interfaces:
Voter, java.io.Serializable
public class Collective
extends java.lang.Object
implements Voter, java.io.Serializable
The Collective class represents collectives through which users with similar interests can associate and support different projects all at the same time, being notified when projects are voted and being able to enter and exit this collectives. Also, collectives can have children so the users can easily find collectives that are interesting to them.
Author:
Pedro Urbina Rodriguez
See Also:

    • leave

      public boolean leave​(User u)
      Removes a User from the members list.
      Parameters:
      u - User that will be removed from the collective.
      Returns:
      True if the user was in the collective and left it, false otherwise.

    • join

      public boolean join​(User u)
      Adds a User to the members list.
      Parameters:
      u - User that will be added to the collective.
      Returns:
      True if the user was not in the collective and joined it, false otherwise.

    • addChildCollective

      public boolean addChildCollective​(Collective c)
      Adds a collective to the childCollectives list, if it is permitted.
      Parameters:
      c - Collective that will be added to the childCollectives list of the collective.
      Returns:
      True if the collective was not already a descendant and has been added to the childCollectives list, false if it cannot be the child of this project (because they are both son of the same parent, if it is already a descendant, or if the project being added has this collective as descendant).

    • getDescendantCollectives

      public java.util.Set<Collective> getDescendantCollectives()
      Returns a set containing all the descendant collectives.
      Returns:
      HashSet containing all the descendant collectives.
